about_the_game:
Explore a region of mystery and danger in Ancient Mind, a modern take on the classic top-down puzzle-action adventure. Explore dungeons, fight monsters, solve puzzles, and discover the truth about ancient legends.



This game will put your spacial awareness to the test with a sequence of environmental puzzles, levels characterized by a non-linear structure made of keys and locks, dungeons full of monsters, traps, and riddles. Even with a map, you will still need to pay close attention to your surroundings and make a mental map of the area if you want to find your way to the end safe and sound.



Ancient Mind is a modern take on the classic zelda-like top-down adventure. Fight monsters with your sword and use tools such as a grappling hook and torches to overcome obstacles and reach new areas. Items like bows and arrows are not only useful in combat, but also for triggering mechanisms in ancient temples. You will find new items as you progress into the game, unlocking paths even in already explored areas.

Sometimes, secret passages will only reveal themselves after you have acquired the necessary equipment or the necessary knowledge.



Legends tell many stories about these lands, stories about an uncertain past. This region was once inhabited by an ancient civilization that now appears to have vanished into thin air, leaving behind nothing but ruins. Will you find the answers you're looking for? There might be clues behind every corner.

Collect information and ask the right questions as you explore the land, put the pieces together, and find out what happened in the past.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Any distribution released after 2016
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo E8200, AMD Athlon XE BE-2300, Raspberry Pi 4, or better
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 5500, AMD Radeon R5 Graphics, or newer
  • Storage: 512 MB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Any distribution released after 2020
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-6600K, AMD Ryzen 5 1600, Raspberry Pi 5, or better
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050, AMD Radeon RX 460, or newer
  • Storage: 512 MB available space
